H0.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Modest Mussorgsky

H1.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Sergei Prokofiev

H2.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Alexander Borodin

H3.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Rimsy-korsakov

A4.text: Rimsky-Korsakov's opera The Golden Cockerel was delayed until 1909, after his death, and even then it was performed in an adapted version.

A5.text: The political controversy continued with his opera The Golden Cockerel. Its implied criticism of monarchy, Russian imperialism and the Russo-Japanese War gave it little chance of passing the censors.
